thread.title: Briefs: Rangers take Game 1 from Jays
thread.title_full: Briefs: Rangers take Game 1 from Jays

title: Briefs: Rangers take Game 1 from Jays
text: Briefs: Rangers take Game 1 from Jays fosters.com Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 10:29 PM Updated at 6:41 PM Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 10:29 PM Updated at 6:41 PM TORONTO — A big day by the bottom of Texas' batting order helped the Rangers overcome an injury to slugger Adrian Beltre in the start of their postseason run. Robinson Chirinos hit a two-run homer against David Price, Rougned Odor added a solo shot and the Rangers beat the Blue Jays 5-3 Thursday in their AL Division Series opener as postseason baseball returned to Toronto for the first time in 22 years. Both starting third baseman left with injuries: Beltre came in the third with a strained muscle in his lower back and Toronto's Josh Donaldson in the fifth after he was kneed in the head while sliding in an attempt to break up a double play. FIFA Blatter suspended as president; Platini also banned ZURICH — Sepp Blatter is out of a job at FIFA. Michel Platini might never even get there. Two of the most powerful men in soccer were handed 90-day suspensions by the FIFA ethics committee on Thursday, essentially ending Blatter's 17-year reign as president and likely stunting Platini's chances of replacing him. — The Associated Press College Hockey UNH, Verizon Wireless Arena to host 2017 NCAA Northeast Reg. INDIANAPOLIS – The NCAA Division I Men’s Ice Hockey Committee announced that the University of New Hampshire in conjunction with the Verizon Wireless Arena in Manchester, N.H. will host the 2017 Division I Men’s Ice Hockey Northeast Regional March 25-26. This will mark the seventh time UNH hosts a men’s ice hockey regional at the Verizon Wireless Arena. The event was previously held there in 2004, 2007, 2009, 2011, 2013 and 2015 with the men’s hockey team advancing to the Northeast Regional at the Verizon Wireless Arena five of the six years. College Soccer UNH women blank Lowell DURHAM — Sophomore Brooke Murphy and junior Kelsey Pratt each scored two goals as the University of New Hampshire women's soccer team defeated the University of Massachusetts Lowell, 4-2, Thursday night at Cowell Stadium. The Wildcats tie last year's conference win total with four this season. Overall, the 'Cats have a record of 6-5-3 and 4-0-0 in conference. The River Hawks fell to 3-10-0 and 0-3-0 in conference. Murphy increased her season total to nine goals with two tonight. Pratt scored her second and third goals of the season. Senior Caroline Murray and sophomores Jackie Feraco and Veronica Hardy each tallied assists. Junior Mimi Borkan recorded two saves, improving her record to 6-5-3 overall. — Staff Reports
